attributes.title: Fresh Start Muffins

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Strawberries and blueberries come together. Blueberries taste great and as for strawberries, everyone loves them. Combine them in a muffin and you get a one of a kind snack that you won’t soon forget.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.  Heat oven to 400ºF. Line 12 medium muffin cups with paper baking cups.
  2.  In large bowl, combine flour, oats, sugar and baking powder; mix well. In small bowl, combine milk, oil, egg and vanilla; blend well. Add to dry ingredients all at once; stir just until dry ingredients are moistened. (Do not over mix.) Gently stir in blueberries and strawberries.
  3.  Fill muffin cups three quarters full. Sprinkle batter in each muffin cup with 1 teaspoon cinnamon‑sugar.
  4.  Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool muffins in pan on wire rack 5 minutes; remove from pan. Serve warm.

  4.  Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool muffins in pan on wire rack 5 minutes; remove from pan. Serve warm.

  • 1 cup low‑fat (1%) milk

attributes.content: It might not have the chocolate your sweet tooth is looking for, but the rich brown sugar, spicy cinnamon and tangy raisins do a great job. You’re far less likely to feel guilty after eating more than you should.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.   Heat oven to 375° F.
  2.   Beat brown sugar, margarine and granulated sugar with electric mixer until creamy. Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.
  3.   In a separate bowl, combine flour, bran, cinnamon, baking soda and salt; mix well. Add to margarine‑sugar mixture; mix well. Stir in oats and dried fruit; mix well.
  4.   Drop by rounded measuring tablespoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 9 to 10 minutes, until light golden brown. (Centres will be soft.)
  5.   Cool 1 minute on cookie sheets, remove to wire rack. Cool completely. Store tightly covered.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.   Heat oven to 350°F. Lightly spray two disposable aluminum foil loaf pans (8‑1/2 x 4‑inch or 8 x 3‑3/4‑inch) with non‑stick cooking spray.
  2.   In large bowl, combine yogourt, tea, honey, oil and egg with wire whisk or fork; mix well. Stir in oats and let stand 10 minutes.
  3.   In medium bowl, combine flour, lemon peel, baking powder, baking soda and salt; mix well. Add to oat mixture; stir just until dry ingredients are moistened. (Do not over mix.) Pour into pans.
  4.   Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in centre of loaf comes out with a few moist crumbs clinging to it.
  5.   Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Store tightly wrapped up to 3 days. Label and freeze for longer storage.

To brew double‑strength tea, bring 2/3 cup water to a rolling boil. Pour boiling water over 2 tea bags. Let stand 1‑1/2 minutes for green tea; 4 minutes for black tea. Remove tea bags. Cool to room temperature before using.
If using non‑disposable loaf pans, cool breads in pans 10 minutes. Loosen breads from sides of pans with narrow metal spatula or knife. Turn out onto cooling rack. Cool completely.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Whisk eggs, milk, green pepper, salt and pepper in small bowl.
  2. Spray skillet with cooking spray.
  3. Heat skillet over medium‑high heat until hot enough to sizzle a drop of water.
  4. Pour in egg mixture and immediately reduce heat to medium‑low.
  5. As eggs begin to set, gently move spatula across bottom and side of skillet to form large, soft curds.
  6. Cook until eggs are thickened and no visible liquid egg remains, but the eggs are not dry.
  7. Sprinkle with cheese.
  8. Spoon the eggs in the centre of the tortilla and top with Tostitos® Salsa.
  9. Fold up the bottom and then the sides to enclose filling.

attributes.title: BBQ Pulled Pork Sliders

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Feast on these sweet and tangy BBQ Pulled Pork Sliders - they’re the perfect party food for the big game or your next backyard barbecue!

Bring some crispy delight to your traditional, homemade pulled pork sandwiches when you add some delicious LAY’S® Barbecue Chips to the mix. With the wide variety of chip choices, you and your family can embrace spontaneity with a different choice every time you serve this simple but delicious sandwich. Fire up the grill for a weekend get-together or plan on these sandwiches while watching the big game, and enjoy the way the chips complement the sweet and tangy taste of the pulled pork.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Mix together the paprika, brown sugar, onion powder, black pepper, salt, garlic and cumin.
  2. Set up your grill for indirect cooking. If using a gas grill, turn on the grill on one side; if using a charcoal grill, build the charcoal fire on one side only. Set a pie plate filled with water under the grill on the non-heated side.
  3. Coat the pork butt roast with the yellow mustard. Gently pat it with the BBQ rub. Set aside any remaining BBQ rub in a sealed plastic container for later use.
  4. Once the grill reaches 121ºC, set the pork butt roast on the non-heated side of the grill over the pan of water. Close the grill lid and cook for 5  hours.
  5. Open the grill. Baste the pork butt roast with the Italian dressing. Wrap the roast in foil.
  6. Cook the pork another 5 to 6 hours. Open it every hour and baste it again. Make sure the grill stays at 121ºC, adding more charcoal if needed. Use a meat thermometer to check the internal temperature of the roast.
  7. When the pork roast reaches 88ºC internally, unwrap it from the foil. Glaze with BBQ sauce. Let it sit for 25 minutes.
  8. Pull the cooked meat off the bone and pile it high on the slider buns. Add extra BBQ sauce if desired. For an unexpected crunch, sprinkle some crunched LAY’S® Barbecue Chips on each sandwich, or simply serve on the side.

• 1 bag of LAY’S® Barbecue Chips
  • 1 7-lb. pork butt roast
  • 1/2 cup paprika
  • 2 cups brown sugar
  • 1/3 cup onion powder
  • 1/4 cup black pepper
  • 1/3 cup salt
  • 1/4 cup garlic
  • 1/4 cup cumin
  • 1/2 cup yellow mustard
  • 1/2 cup Italian dressing
  • 1 cup BBQ sauce
  • 24 slider buns

attributes.title: Salt & Vinegar Potato Chip Mac and Cheese

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Salt & Vinegar Potato Chip Mac and Cheese

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Indulge in this rich and creamy Clam Chowder - it’s an easy, all-season recipe that can feed an army or make a perfect date-night dinner for two.
Salt & Vinegar Potato Chip Mac and Cheese

Take the ordinary out of mac and cheese when you make this comfort food favorite with LAY'S® Salt & Vinegar Flavoured Potato Chips. Tasty salt and tangy vinegar transform this classic fare from a trusty side dish into a full-fledged family entree. Serve this creamy treat with fruit for lunch on a rainy day, or pair it with cubed, grilled chicken and a salad for a satisfying dinner. This tasty recipe serves four but can easily be doubled to accommodate more.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.  Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat.
  2.  Stir in the flour. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring. Stir in 1 cup of milk at a time, cooking for 1 minute before adding the next cup.
  3.  Stir in the thyme, nutmeg, salt and cayenne pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes until sauce starts to thicken. Remove from heat.
  4.   Cook the macaroni in boiling water. Drain the macaroni.
  5.  Crumble the LAY'S® Salt & Vinegar Flavoured Potato Chips. Combine with Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs and butter in a large saucepan. Stir over medium heat 5 minutes, until golden brown.
  6.  Combine the sauce with the Cheddar cheese, Gruyère cheese and mustard. Cook, stirring for 3 minutes until the cheese melts.
  7.  Combine the macaroni and cheese sauce. Spoon into four ramekins. Top with the potato-chip topping.

attributes.title: Oat and Bean Veggie Burgers

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Surprise your guests with these nourishing, flavourful veggie burgers at your next party or BBQ - the cheesy kick will have everyone asking for seconds.

These oat and bean veggie burgers make the perfect lunch for vegetarians or anyone who enjoys a hearty, flavourful burger. Combine northern beans with oats, vegetables and a variety of spices to create these delectable burgers. CHEETOS® Crunchy Cheese Flavoured Snacks add a crunchy texture to the burgers with a cheesy kick that keeps you coming back for more. Serve these tasty burgers for a fun family dinner, or grill them up at your next backyard picnic. Serve them with a variety of toppings and condiments so your guests can customize their burgers.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.  Add oats to large skillet over medium heat; toast for 3 minutes, stirring frequently.
  2.  Remove oats from heat; add to a large mixing bowl.
  3.  Add 1 teaspoon canola oil to same skillet over medium heat.
  4.  Sauté onion and garlic for 3 minutes; remove from heat, and add to mixing bowl with oats.
  5.  Add CHEETOS®, beans, chilies, yogurt, lemon juice and pepper to mixing bowl; mix together.
  6.  Form six 3-inch burgers using your hands.
  7.  Add 2 teaspoons canola oil to skillet over medium heat; cook burgers for 4 minutes.
  8.  Flip burgers; cook 3 minutes.

attributes.title: Layered Doritos Tacos

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Hungry? Get ready for the perfect nachos! With this quick and easy dinner recipe, a crunchy, cheesy meal can be on the table in 20 minutes!

Save yourself the mess of traditional hard-shell tacos when you toss together these yummy layered tacos using Doritos® Nacho Cheese Flavoured Tortilla Chips as your bold base. Put a crunchy and delicious dinner on the table in about 20 minutes. The Doritos® Nacho Cheese Flavoured Tortilla Chips add a little extra tang to your fork-ready layered tacos for a unique flavour combination. This recipe makes enough for four to six servings, and it takes about five minutes of prep time and 15 minutes of cooking time. Fun Fact: Frito-Lay® first sold Doritos® Nacho Cheese Flavoured Tortilla Chips in 1972.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.   Cook the ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until brown. Drain off any excess grease.
  2.   Mix the taco seasoning in with the meat.
  3.   Stir in the diced tomatoes.
  4.   Simmer the meat for 5 to 10 minutes until the liquid is absorbed. Stir occasionally.
  5.   Place a handful of Doritos® chips on each plate. Top with 2 large spoonfuls of the meat mixture, then about 2 tablespoons of shredded cheese. Repeat on each plate.
  6.   Repeat the layers: A handful of Doritos® chips, 2 large spoonfuls of meat and 2 tablespoons of shredded cheese. Top with the shredded lettuce and jalapenos (optional).

attributes.title: Smoky BBQ Cheese Quesadillas

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: You’ll love the sweet and smoky taste of these quesadillas on game day or for a backyard BBQ, and the easy recipe makes serving seconds a snap.

Doctor up the traditional cheese quesadilla with RUFFLES® Sour Cream & Onion Flavoured Potato Chips. With the wide variety of chip choices, you and your family can enjoy mixing it up with different options every time you serve this simple and delicious meal. Fire up the grill on a summer day, or prepare these quesadillas for a big game. You'll love how the chips complement the sweet and smoky taste of the quesadillas. Don't forget to serve an ice-cold PEPSI® MAX with this tasty treat.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Bring the grill to medium heat.
  2. Spread a teaspoon of butter over one side of each tortilla.
  3. Cut 8 tortilla-sized squares of aluminum foil, and lay each tortilla onto the foil with the butter facing down.
  4. Stir the cheeses with the green onions, barbecue sauce and crushed chips, and spread the mixture evenly over the non-buttered side of each tortilla.
  5. Lay each tortilla foil-side down on the grill, and cook until the tortillas are light brown.
  6. Remove the tortillas from the grill, cut the quesadillas into triangles, and serve immediately with a side of barbecue sauce.

attributes.title: Easy-Peasy Pizzas

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Looking for simple snack ideas for kids and teens? Your family will devour these quick and easy cheesy snacks after school or between practices.

When your family clamors for pizza, serve them up this quick and easy snack filled with cheesy flavour. This recipe is so simple, you can even use it as a starter recipe to teach your kids to start cooking. Just add the bold, flavourful crunch of DORITOS® Nacho Cheese Flavoured Tortilla Chips to make the recipe extra special. Serve up these yummy snacks at a sleepover party, have them waiting as an after school snack, or add some milk and fruit to turn it into a whole meal.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.   Preheat the oven to broil or prepare a toaster oven for use.
  2.   Separate and lightly toast the English muffin halves.
  3.   Place the English muffin halves on a baking sheet. Spread the English muffins with tomato sauce.
  4.   Layer one piece of mozzarella cheese on each English muffin half. Crumble some DORITOS® Tortilla Chips on top.
  5.   Place a red pepper ring on top.
  6.  Set the English muffin halves under the broiler for 2 minutes or heat them in the toaster oven till the cheese melts.
  7.   Serve with more Doritos® Nacho Cheese Flavoured Tortilla Chips.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.  Heat oven to 350°F. Lightly spray bottom only of 9 x 5‑inch, or 2 (8 x 4‑inch) metal loaf pan with cooking spray. In medium bowl, combine oats and milk; mix well. Set aside.
  2.  In large bowl, combine all‑purpose flour, whole‑wheat flour, sugar, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda and salt; mix well.
  3.  Add pumpkin, eggs, oil and raisins to oat mixture; mix well. Add to dry ingredients all at once; stir just until dry ingredients are moistened. (Do not overmix.) Pour into pan.
  4.  Bake 55 to 65 minutes (9 x 5‑inch loaf) or 45 to 55 minutes (8 x 4‑inch loaf), or until wooden pick inserted in centre comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes in pan; remove to wire rack. Cool completely before slicing. Store tightly wrapped.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.   Mix tomatoes, garlic, oil, salt and pepper to taste and spread on to a foil covered cookie sheet or roasting pan.
  2.   Roast in oven for 30-45 minutes or until tomatoes wilt. Cool for 10 minutes.
  3.   Place roasted tomatoes and garlic mix into blender.
  4.   Add warm stock to taste. Garnish with fresh basil.
  5.   Swirl cream and sprinkle basil on top before serving.
  6.   Serve with Stacy’s® Toasted Cheddar Pita Chips on the side or as a topping.

These crunchy tortilla chips that your family already loves are the perfect secret ingredient to turn a standard macaroni salad into something they’ll adore. Serve it at an afternoon barbecue in the backyard, or pack it up to take it to a church or school potluck, and don’t be surprised when friends ask you for the recipe.

1.   Cook the macaroni according to package directions.
  2.   While the macaroni is cooking, dice the green onions, dill pickles, red onion, tomato and bell pepper.
  3.   Rinse the macaroni with cold water and drain.
  4.   Add the mayonnaise and sour cream to the macaroni. Mix thoroughly.
  5.   Chop the hard-boiled eggs. Crumble the DORITOS® Tortilla Chips
  6.   Add the green onions, dill pickles, red onions, tomato, bell pepper, Dijon mustard, black pepper, salt, hard-boiled eggs and tortilla chips. Mix thoroughly.

attributes.content: Discover your next favourite recipe! We have the best breakfast ideas, the easiest appetizers, the hottest dinners and the coolest desserts.
Caramel-Topped Cheesecake with Oat Pecan Crust

You know that saying “you can’t have too much of a good thing”? This recipe embraces that thought on every level. Easy to prepare, and totally decadent, this single serve cheesecake might be devoured quickly, but is sure to be talked about for many days to come.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.   Heat oven to 375°F.
  2.   Line 18 medium muffin cups with foil liners.
  3.   In large bowl, combine oats, pecans, 1/2 cup of the brown sugar, and the butter, blending well. Spoon about 2 tablespoons of the mixture into bottom of each foil‑lined muffin cup, then press evenly and firmly to form crust.
  4.   Bake 8 to 10 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool.
  5.   Reduce oven temperature to 325°F.
  6.   In large bowl, beat cream cheese on medium‑high speed of electric mixer until light and fluffy, scraping bowl occasionally. Add remaining 3/4 cup brown sugar and vanilla; blend well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating just until blended. Add sour cream; mix well. Divide batter evenly among prepared muffin cups.
  7.   Bake about 20 to 22 minutes, or just until set.
  8.   Cool in pans on wire rack. Chill at least 2 hours.
  9.   Just before serving, top each individual cheesecake with scant tablespoon of butterscotch caramel topping (if too thick to spread, place in microwave for a few seconds to soften). Sprinkle a few grains of sea salt over and serve.

  • 2 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, softened

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.   Preheat oven to 350° F.
  2.   In a large (11 or 12‑inch) ovenproof skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
  3.   Add garlic and red pepper flakes, sauté 1 minute.
  4.   Mix in kale and water; sauté 3 – 4 minutes or until kale starts to wilt a bit.
  5.   Turn off heat.
  6.   Mix in beans, ricotta, half of the Parmesan cheese (1/6 cup) and half of the crushed Tostitos® Restaurant Style Tortilla Chips.
  7.   Turn off heat.
  8.   In a small bowl, mix together remaining parmesan cheese and crushed Tostitos® Restaurant Style Tortilla Chips.
  9.   Serve warm.

  • 1 tablespoon Olive oil
  • 3 Garlic cloves, minced
  • 1/2 teaspoon Red pepper flakes
  • 220g Kale, torn and tough ribs removed
  • 1/4 cup water
  • 2 (425 g) cans No‑salt added cannellini beans, drained and rinsed*
  • 1/4 cup Part‑skim ricotta cheese
  • 1/3 cup Grated Parmesan cheese

*If you can’t find no‑salt added canned beans, use regular canned beans.

attributes.title: New England Style Clam Chowder

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Indulge in this rich and creamy Clam Chowder - it’s an easy, all-season recipe that can feed an army or make a perfect date-night dinner for two.

Gather the family together to enjoy a new take on a favorite recipe with the added crunch of LAY'S® Classic Potato Chips. In just a half an hour, you and your family can savour the flavour of this fresh-tasting, hearty dish. The potato chips complement the creamy clam chowder with a surprising, crispy texture that's sure to spread smiles and good cheer. Use leftover chips from this Party Size bag to make the recipe a second time, or double or triple the recipe to serve guests at a party or larger family gathering.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Cook the bacon in a large pot until just under crispy.
  2. Add the butter, onion and celery and sauté until softened, stirring often.
  3. Stir in the flour and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring frequently.
  4. Add the chicken stock, the juice from 2 cans of chopped clams, cream, bay leaves and potatoes, and whisk to get out any flour lumps.
  5. Bring to a simmer, stirring frequently until the mixture thickens.
  6. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 20 minutes, stirring often, until the potatoes are nice and tender.
  7. Add the clams and season to taste with salt and pepper.
  8. Cook another 2 minutes.
  9. Crush the LAY'S® Classic Potato Chips. Serve the chowder with the crushed chips on top.

  • 2 cups heavy cream

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Preheat the oven to 121ºC.
  2. Melt the butter in a microwave safe bowl. Set aside to cool.
  3. Sift the flour together with the cornstarch, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
  4. Add the sugar, milk, eggs and vanilla to the butter. Mix well.
  5. Add the sprinkles. Add flour mixture, and fold until well blended.
  6. Line muffin tins with 18 cupcake liners. Fill each cupcake liner 2/3 full.
  7. Bake 12-18 minutes, or until cupcake tops are light gold and a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
  8. Let cool completely.
  9. Spread the cupcakes with vanilla frosting. Sprinkle them with kosher salt.
  10. Place crushed LAY'S® Classic Potato Chips in a shallow bowl. Dip the top of the cupcakes in the chips, pressing lightly so that they stick to the frosting.
  11. Top with additional sprinkles if desired.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.  Heat oven to 325°F. Beat margarine and sugar until creamy. Add egg and vanilla; beat well. Add combined flour, oats and salt; mix well.
  2.  Shape dough into 1‑inch balls. Press desired candy piece into centre of each ball; shape dough around candy so it is completely hidden.
  3.  Roll cookies in coloured sugar or candy sprinkles until evenly coated. Place 1‑1/2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
  4.  Bake 14 to 17 minutes or until set and bottoms are light golden brown. Remove to wire rack. Cool completely. Store tightly covered.

For gift giving: Pack in holiday cookie tins or make cookie bundles. To make bundles, arrange a few cookies in the centre of a square of food‑safe wrap. Form into a bundle and tie closed at top with ribbon.

Variation: For powdered sugar‑coated cookies, bake uncoated cookies as directed above. Remove to wire rack; cool 5 minutes. Place about 3/4 cup powdered sugar in plastic bag. Gently shake 3 to 4 cookies in powdered sugar until coated. Repeat with remaining cookies. Sift remaining powdered sugar over cookies. Cool completely.

  4.  Bake 14 to 17 minutes or until set and bottoms are light golden brown. Remove to wire rack. Cool completely. Store tightly covered.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1.  Heat oven to 350° F.
  2.  In large bowl, combine half the dry cake mix with butter, egg and vanilla; mix thoroughly with large spoon. Stir in remaining cake mix and oats; mix well.
  3.  Divide dough in half. On well‑floured surface, using a well‑floured rolling pin, roll each half to no more than 1/4‑inch thickness.
  4.  Cut dough with 3‑inch snowflake or other large holiday cookie cutter. Place about 1‑inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
  5.  If cookies will be used as tree ornaments, poke a hole at the top of each cookie with drinking straw before baking. (Repeat immediately after baking if hole closes.)
  6.  Bake 6 to 8 minutes or just until set (centres may still be soft). Carefully remove to wire rack; cool completely. If desired, decorate cookies.

Decorating Ideas:
Sprinkle with coloured sugars, candy sprinkles or small candies before baking.
Sprinkle baked cookies with powdered sugar as they cool.
Frost cooled cookies with homemade or ready‑to‑spread frosting. Sprinkle with glitter sugar or coloured sugar. Squeeze melted dark or white chocolate, decorator frosting or decorator gel in tubes onto cooled cookies
NOTE: Dragees (small silver and gold ball‑shaped decorations) are inedible and should only be placed on cookies that will be used for decorations and not eaten.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. In bowl, stir together oats, milk, lemon juice and cinnamon; cover and refrigerate overnight.
  2. In the morning, stir oats with shredded apple, yogurt and honey. Divide among 6 bowls; serve with apricots, raisins and almonds to sprinkle over top.

Tip: You can replace the milk with fortified soy, almond, or rice milk.

A springtime brunch favourite – with a twist! We’ve replaced the traditional bacon and English muffin with spears of asparagus and creamy oatmeal cooked with fresh herbs.

attributes.name: twitter:description
attributes.content: Discover Tasty Rewards: easy recipes and fun snack ideas, coupons, contests, and giveaways. Host the best parties with our tips, tricks and freebies!

body.value: A springtime brunch favourite – with a twist! We’ve replaced the traditional bacon and English muffin with spears of asparagus and creamy oatmeal cooked with fresh herbs.
body.processed: A springtime brunch favourite – with a twist! We’ve replaced the traditional bacon and English muffin with spears of asparagus and creamy oatmeal cooked with fresh herbs.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. In large saucepan, bring water and salt to boil; stir in oats. Reduce heat to medium; simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until oats are desired consistency. Stir in cheese and chives.
  2. Meanwhile, in pot of boiling salted water, cook asparagus for 3 to 5 minutes or until tender‑crisp; drain and refresh under cold water.
  3. For Hollandaise Sauce, in small saucepan, heat butter over medium heat until melted and bubbling. In blender, purée yolks, lemon zest, lemon juice and mustard; add butter in slow, steady stream with motor running. Season with salt.
  4. Divide oatmeal among 6 plates. Top each serving with two asparagus spears and poached egg; spoon Hollandaise Sauce over top.

Tip: To Poach an Egg: Fill a saucepan with enough water to come about 6 inches up side. Add 2 tbsp (30 mL) vinegar and bring to boil. Crack egg into small bowl; slip gently into boiling water. Reduce heat to simmer; poach eggs for 3 or 4 minutes or until desired doneness. Remove each egg with slotted spoon.

Reduce heat to simmer; poach eggs for 3 or 4 minutes or until desired doneness. Remove each egg with slotted spoon.

• 2 cups Quaker® Quick Cook Steel Cut Oats
  • 1 cup shredded aged Cheddar cheese
  • 6 cups water
  • 1/2 teaspoons salt
  • 1/4 cup chopped fresh chives or parsley
  • 12 spears asparagus, trimmed
  • 6 poached eggs

Hollandaise Sauce:

  • 2/3 cup butter
  • 3 egg yolks
  • 1 teaspoon lemon zest
  • 2 teaspoons lemon juice
  • 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease 8 inch (20 cm) square baking dish.
  2. In large bowl, mix together oats, dates, apricots, almonds, brown sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, cloves, salt and pepper. In separate bowl, whisk together almond milk, eggs and butter; stir into oats mixture.
  3. Pour into prepared baking dish; bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until mixture is set. Remove from oven; let cool for a few minutes. Cut into squares.

Tip: These bars can also be refrigerated and served cold.

body.value: Take the chill off late winter with the whole-grain goodness of oats cooked with bacon and topped with softly scrambled eggs.
body.processed: Take the chill off late winter with the whole-grain goodness of oats cooked with bacon and topped with softly scrambled eggs.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. In saucepan, bring stock to simmer; keep hot. In separate large saucepan, cook bacon over medium‑high heat for 5 to 7 minutes or until crisp; drain on paper towel. Chop bacon; set aside.
  2. Add onion to bacon grease remaining in saucepan; cook for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add oats; cook, stirring to coat, for 2 minutes.
  3. Pour in stock; cook, stirring, for 6 to 8 minutes or until oats are tender and creamy and most of the liquid is absorbed. Stir in half of the bacon.
  4. Whisk together eggs, water, salt and pepper. In nonstick skillet, heat butter over medium heat; cook eggs, stirring with a spatula to form large soft curds, for about 3 minutes or until desired consistency.
  5. Spoon oatmeal into bowls. Top with eggs; sprinkle with tomato, green onions and remaining bacon.

  4. Whisk together eggs, water, salt and pepper. In nonstick skillet, heat butter over medium heat; cook eggs, stirring with a spatula to form large soft curds, for about 3 minutes or until desired consistency.

  • 6 eggs

  • 1 tablespoon butter
  • 1 tomato, chopped
  • 2 green onions, chopped

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. In a large saucepan, bring water and salt to boil; stir in oats and herbs. Reduce heat to medium; simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until oats are desired consistency. Stir in Parmesan.
  2. Spread oat mixture in even layer into greased 13‑ x 9‑inch (3 L) baking dish; refrigerate until cool and firm, about 2 hours or overnight.
  3. Tomato Onion Salad: Meanwhile, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, basil, salt and pepper in large bowl; toss with tomatoes and onion.
  4. Carefully turn out oatmeal onto cutting board; cut into 12 squares. In nonstick skillet, heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil over medium ;high heat; fry oatmeal squares in batches, adding remaining oil as necessary, for about 3 minutes per side or until golden. Top with Tomato Onion Salad, and fried eggs (if desired).

1. In medium saucepan, bring milk just to a boil.
  2. Stir in remaining ingredients.
  3. Cook about 1 minute for quick oats or 5 minutes for oldfashioned oats, stirring occasionally.

Microwave Directions: For quick oats, combine all ingredients except chocolate pieces in 2‑quart. microwaveable bowl. Microwaveat HIGH 4 to 5 minutes. Stir in chocolate pieces; let stand 1 minute.

From first-time bakers to the most experienced, Banana Muffins are a treat that has stood the test of time. Everybody loves them, and they’re by far one of the easiest and quickest recipes in the world of baking. Add the goodness of Quaker whole grains to the mix, and you’ve got a recipe that’s just as nutritious as it is delicious.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Heat oven to 400°F. Line twelve medium muffin cups with paper baking cups or spray bottoms only with cooking spray.
  2. In large bowl, combine flour, oats, sugar, nuts, if desired, baking powder and baking soda; mix well. In medium bowl, combine bananas, margarine, milk and egg whites; blend well.
  3. Add to dry ingredients all at once; stir just until dry ingredients are moistened. (Do not over mix.)
  4. Fill muffin cups almost full. Bake 17 to 19 minutes or until golden brown.
  5. Cool muffins in pan on wire rack 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Serve warm.

  4. Fill muffin cups almost full. Bake 17 to 19 minutes or until golden brown.
  5. Cool muffins in pan on wire rack 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Serve warm.

  • 1 tablespoon baking powder
  • 1 cup mashed ripe bananas (about 3 medium)
  • 5 tablespoons margarine or butter, melted
  • 1/2 cup low-fat milk
  • 2 egg whites or 1 egg, lightly beated

Everything tastes better with cheese. There’s no doubt that the smell of fresh bread is very powerful but fresh cheese bread is a fantastic upgrade. Either as a side dish to a delicious home cooked meal or just as a snack, Tangy Buttermilk Cheese Bread is something you will want to make as often as you can.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Bring all refrigerated ingredients to room temperature by letting them stand on counter about 30 minutes.
  2. Place yeast in bread machine pan according to directions in manual. In medium bowl, combine flour, oats, sugar and salt; mix well. Stir in cheese.
  3. Place dry ingredients and buttermilk in bread machine pan according to manual. Select white bread and light crust settings. Remove bread from pan to wire rack. Cool completely before slicing.

Refrigerated ingredients (except eggs) can be warmed to room temperature quickly by microwaving them for 15 to 20 seconds on HIGH.

Refrigerated ingredients (except eggs) can be warmed to room temperature quickly by microwaving them for 15 to 20 seconds on HIGH.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Heat oven to 400°F.
  2. Lightly grease cookie sheet.
  3. In large bowl, combine flour, oats, 1/4 cup sugar, baking powder and salt; mix well. Cut in margarine with pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in currants. In small bowl, combine milk and egg; blend well. Add to dry ingredients all at once; stir with fork just until dry ingredients are moistened. (Do not over mix)
  4. Turn dough out onto lightly floured surface; knead gently 8 to 10 times. Roll or pat dough into 8‑inch circle about 1/2 inch thick. Sprinkle with combined remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and cinnamon. Cut into 10 wedges; place on cookie sheet.

In small bowl, combine milk and egg; blend well. Add to dry ingredients all at once; stir with fork just until dry ingredients are moistened. (Do not over mix)
  4. Turn dough out onto lightly floured surface; knead gently 8 to 10 times. Roll or pat dough into 8‑inch circle about 1/2 inch thick. Sprinkle with combined remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and cinnamon. Cut into 10 wedges; place on cookie sheet.

Update your everyday oatmeal with the decadent addition of apricot, honey and cinnamon. Hearty and flavourful, this recipe makes the morning much, much brighter.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. In 3 quart saucepan, bring water, apricots, honey, and cinnamon to a boil.
  2. Stir in oats; return to a boil.
  3. Reduce heat to medium; cook about 1 minute for quick oats (or 5 minutes for large flake oats) or until most of liquid is absorbed, stirring occasionally.
  4. Let stand until of desired consistency.

If desired, substitute raisins, dried peaches or pears, dried cranberries or blueberries, dried apples, dates or diced mixed dried fruit for apricots.

  4. Let stand until of desired consistency.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Heat oven to 400°F. Line twelve medium muffin cups with paper baking cups or spray bottoms only with non‑stick cooking spray.
  2. In large bowl, combine 1‑1/2 cups oats, all‑purpose flour, whole‑wheat flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt; mix well. Add raisins and nuts and mix well. In small bowl, combine applesauce, apple juice, and oil; blend well. Add to dry ingredients all at once; stir just until dry ingredients are moistened. (Do not over mix)
  3. Fill muffin cups almost full.
  4. Bake 20 to 22 minutes or until golden brown. Cool muffins in pan on wire rack 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Serve warm.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. In medium saucepan, bring milk to a gentle boil. (Watch carefully.)
  2. Stir in oats, cranberries and Aunt Jemima<sup>®</sup> Syrup. Return to a boil; reduce heat to medium.
  3. Cook 1 minute for quick oats, 5 minutes for large flake oats or until most of milk is absorbed, stirring occasionally.
  4. Let stand until desired consistency. Stir in wheat germ. Spoon oatmeal into four cereal bowls.
  5. Drizzle with additional syrup, if desired. Serve with milk or yogurt, if desired.

Freeze single servings of cooked oatmeal in small resealable freezer bags. Thaw in refrigerator overnight. Transfer to microwave safe bowl. Microwave, covered, on DEFROST until hot, stirring once or twice.Microwave Directions: In 3‑quart microwaveable bowl, combine all ingredients except wheat germ. Microwave on HIGH 6 to 7 minutes for quick oats and 9 to 10 minutes for large flake oats or until most of liquid is absorbed.
Let stand until desired consistency. Stir in wheat germ

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Combine milk, oats, raisins and cranberries in medium bowl; cover and refrigerate overnight
  2. Remove oats mixture from refrigerator; drain any excess liquid.
  3. Add condensed milk, lemon juice, apple, almonds and nut/seed mixture; mix well. If desired, garnish with a sprig of mint.

Chill Time: 8 hours

Add a little spice to your morning muffins. That spice is cinnamon, which is always a nice touch to most baked goods. Combine that with a lovely streusel topping and you’ve got a great little snack.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Preheat oven to 400° F.
  2. Remove oats mixture from refrigerator; drain any excess liquid.
  3. Spray 12 medium muffin cups with non‑fat cooking spray or line with paper baking cups.
  4. For streusel topping, combine oats, flour, sugar and cinnamon in small bowl.
  5. Cut in margarine with pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Set aside.
  6. For muffin, combine flour, pancake mix, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon and nutmeg in medium bowl.
  7. In small bowl, combine milk, oil and egg; add to flour mixture. Mix just until dry ingredients are moistened. Stir in raisins, if desired.
  8. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon streusel evenly over each muffin.
  9. Bake 18-20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.
  10. Cool 2 minutes in pan. Remove to cooling rack.

  5. Cut in margarine with pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Set aside.
  6. For muffin, combine flour, pancake mix, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon and nutmeg in medium bowl.
  7. In small bowl, combine milk, oil and egg; add to flour mixture. Mix just until dry ingredients are moistened. Stir in raisins, if desired.
  8. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon streusel evenly over each muffin.
  9. Bake 18-20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.
  10. Cool 2 minutes in pan. Remove to cooling rack.

Quaker mixes these together with some oats and other simple ingredients to give you a great new batch of muffins that you won’t be able to forget.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Heat oven to 400°F. Line 12 medium muffin cups with paper baking cups.
  2. In medium bowl, combine oats, flours, baking powder and 1/2 cup pecans; mix well. In medium bowl, beat sugar, margarine and cream cheese until creamy.
  3. Add milk, egg and maple extract; mix well. Add to dry ingredients; stir just until dry ingredients are moistened. (Do not overmix)
  4. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup pecans.
  5. Bake 20 to 22 minutes or until golden brown.
  6. Cool muffins in pan on wire rack 5 minutes.
  7. Remove from pan.

To freeze muffins, wrap securely; seal, label and freeze. To reheat frozen muffins, unwrap muffins; microwave at HIGH about 45 seconds per muffin.

  • 1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar

  • 1 teaspoon maple or vanilla extract
  • 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1/3 cup whole wheat flour
  • 1 tablespoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 3/4 cup chopped pecans, divided

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. In medium saucepan, bring juice, cinnamon and salt, if desired, to a boil; stir in oats, apple and syrup.
  2. Return to a boil; reduce heat to medium. Cook 1 minute for quick oats or 5 minutes for large flake oats or until most of juice is absorbed, stirring occasionally.
  3. Stir in nuts, if desired.
  4. Let stand until desired consistency.

Microwave Directions: In 3‑quart microwaveable bowl, combine all ingredients except nuts. Microwave on HIGH 6 to 7 minutes for quick oats and 9 to 10 minutes for large oats or until most of juice is absorbed. Stir in nuts, if desired. Let stand until of desired consistency.

Add a little sunshine to your breakfast cereal, pancakes or yogurt by adding a little Sunshine Morning Granola into the mix. Chopped pecans, your favourite pieces of dried fruit and Large Flake Quaker Oats all combined with vanilla, cinnamon and the zest of fresh grated orange peel is a delicious way to kick start your day.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Heat oven to 350°F.
  2. Combine all ingredients except dried fruit in large bowl; mix well. Spread evenly in 15 x 10‑inch jelly roll pan or 13 x 9‑inch baking pan.
  3. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown, stirring once after 10 minutes. Cool completely in pan.
  4. Stir in dried fruit. Store tightly covered up to 5 days.

  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/8 teaspoon salt
  • 2/3 cup diced dried mixed fruit (about 3 ounces)

Canadian winters are cold. That’s a fact. But sometimes even the smallest treat can help warm things up. Let our quick and easy Tropical Granola recipe be your ticket out of the chill. With sweet tropical flavours infused right in, this incredibly versatile granola recipe will have you dreaming of sandy beaches and palm trees in no time.

field_recipe_how_to_make.value:
1. Heat oven to 350°F.
  2. In large bowl, combine oats, almonds and, if desired, crystallized ginger; mix well. In small bowl, combine honey, butter, ground ginger and salt; blend well. Drizzle over oat mixture; mix well. Spread evenly in 15 x 10‑inch jelly roll pan.
  3. Bake 18 to 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes. Remove from oven; immediately stir in dried fruit. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Store in tightly covered container.
  4. Serve with milk as a breakfast cereal, stir into low‑fat yogurt, or sprinkle over fresh fruit, ice cream or frozen yogurt.
